direction.raw_text: Um, can anyone spare... (to the DRIVER) How much to St. John the Divine please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About 15 bucks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the crowd) Can anyone spare $15 please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about tip? You cheapskate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ? The crowd just stare back. The taxi drives away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! STOP! Arthur looks at a STREET CLOCK: 11:53. Arthur starts running in his underwear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - CONTINUOUS GUESTS are taking their pews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - CONTINUOUS Arthur runs along Fifth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - CONTINUOUS Susan is being fussed over by BRIDESMAIDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur runs up Broadway, passing a Watch and Clock store. Every timepiece reads 11:54.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - CONTINUOUS Burt, sitting in a pew, looks at his watch. He looks around for Arthur then scowls very scarily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur stops, out of breath. He sees A LINE OF STREET ENTERTAINERS. That gives him an idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gather round for the nearly naked Yoga man - YOGI BARE! I give you... Arthur strikes a sequence of silly poses and names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `Chicken forgetting birthday'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: throw money. Arthur grabs it up. He looks up at the Times Square digital clock: 11:56.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TAXI! A taxi stops. Arthur throws the money to THE DRIVER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far can I go with $1.95 and a Japanese coin with a hole in it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A block and a half.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Arthur jumps in. The cab screeches away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cab halts. Arthur jumps out and starts running again. He sees A BUS with `COLUMBUS CIRCLE' in its window. We cut to people cheering Arthur, hanging on the bus's front bicycle rack. But the DRIVER sees him and hits the brakes. Arthur's flung forwards but gets up and keeps running. He sees a Subway Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, are there trains down there, like in films?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Arthur runs down the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A train pulls on to the platform. Arthur leaps aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur stands among New Yorkers, none of whom bat an eyelid at his appearance. He looks up at the stations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to A MALE PASSENGER) Excuse me. Terribly sorry to bother you, but... Without looking at him, the guy hands him a dollar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crikey. Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SACRISTY - DAY - CONTINUOUS Susan is ready. She looks to the door. Erica, who is peering out, shakes her head with an `I told you so' look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naomi's driving her bus up 42nd Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into a headset mic) ...originally a rough neighbourhood. Some say it was called 42nd Street because it wasn't safe to spend more than forty seconds on it. A few grudging laughs from the tourists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you burst into song, you're off this bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? I want to see St. John the Divine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, sir, that's not on our route today. Anyway...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know if Arthur's gonna make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be there for him. Other tourists agree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says here `ask about your personalised tours'. I want the personalised tour. To St. John the Divine!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I! St. John the Divine, St. John the Divine, St. John the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Arthur comes bounding out of another station. Clutching his dollar, he sees a bus. He runs aboard, and up to the driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah! I'm trying to get to... Arthur feels eyes on him. The bus is full of SCHOOL CHILDREN! It's a school bus! They all stare for a beat, then get out cellphones to report the weirdo in their midst, who runs off again and up Broadway, passing a store's line of shopping carts. He starts emptying them of quarters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! A police car rounds the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, unit 6J, we have reports of an indecent exposure on a school bus. Arthur jumps in a shopping cart; as the truck passes, he launches forward, grabbing the rear fender!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt gets up, squeezing past TIGER WOODS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur's cab pulls up outside the church, surrounded by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Arthur leaps out and fights his way through the crowd. People start to recognise the crazed, sweating panting weirdo in underwear. Paparazzi and pedestrians photograph and film him. He runs into the church.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE GREAT, GOOD, RICH AND FAMOUS

direction.raw_text: DAY - CONTINUOUS The church is packed with THE GREAT, GOOD, RICH AND FAMOUS. Vivienne sits waiting. Arthur stumbles in at the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur's trying to inch along the back. But the congregation falls silent, watching him. He stumbles up the aisle, looking up to Jesus, in similar scantily-clad appearance, on a cross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not him. (shows his wrists) Look ma! No holes. Arthur slips in a side door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan is sitting, sad, Bridesmaids comforting her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Susan? Susan turns and is shocked to see Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur? What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan. I can't...I can't... He leads her away from the bridesmaids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl at the party? The one who talked all that rubbish about Coffee Mate? I love her. Susan slaps Arthur. Hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! We're getting married!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I don't love you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you think I love you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yes. What's not to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan, you're upset, you hate me. It's okay. Now I'm sorry, I have to go, or your dad's going to do whatever he did to your boyfriend from college.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy never hurt Alex. He paid her parents to send her away..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ? You're..a...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lesbian. Yes. You may have noticed that daddy is homophobic. He swore he'd disown me if it happened again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...why do you want to marry... Arthur glances across, sees Erica skulking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on. Am I your beard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why else do you think I'd spend more than 30 seconds in your company? You're the perfect cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you been pretending to like Dane Cook as well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Wow. Well. Uh... (heads to the door) Thanks for your honesty. I don't feel so bad about calling this off. Erica steps in his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur, please. You can drink as much as you like, sneak off to Naomi. We keep the money. We live our lives. Everyone wins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I may be a weak, pathetic drunk. But I won't marry a lesbian Dane Cook fan. Arthur pushes past Erica.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ALTAR - NIGHT Arthur stumbles out on the altar. The CONGREGATION stares. He taps a mic from the pulpit like a stand up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good evening, St. John the Divine! Anyone in from St. Patrick's? Bialystoker Synagogue? Manhattan Mosque? AA?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naomi's tour bus screeches up. She hurries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHURCH - DAY Arthur's still before the congregation, telling a story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and the first turned to the second horse and said `That dog just spoke'. The hateful silence that only 500 angry rich people can muster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The joke being that it's inconsistent that the horses can speak but the dog can't. Naomi creeps in at the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wedding's off. The bride has had second thoughts. I can't say I blame her. Would you marry me? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't be seeing me again, as I'm going to be poor. I'll be shopping at the 99 Cent Store. Six pork chops for under a dollar!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: discreetly scribbles `99c Store, chops' on a torn- out Bible page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. I'm glad we had this talk. I'll let you get on with the wedding.... A huge crucifix strikes Arthur hard. Burt, crazed with hatred, drags him by his hair off the altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SACRISTY. DAY - CONTINUOUS Burt is bashing Arthur's head HARD against a stone font.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy, no! Stop it! Vivienne bursts in. Followed by Naomi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt! Get off my son! But nothing's going to stop Burt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (louder than anyone yet)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Susan is over Burt, brandishing a Virgin Mary statue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't hurt me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't I? You crushed me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wanted you to be happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit. You wanted to stop me being a lesbian!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! Shut up you dirty little dyke harlot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Erica leaps on Burt, pummelling his face with her fists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want some more, bitch? Huh? Arthur looks up at Susan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Erica, that's enough, honey. Erica stops. Susan kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me? We could have worked something out. Naomi give Arthur a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm joking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The church is empty, apart from Arthur and Naomi on the altar. Naomi's trying to remove something from Arthur's neck. Vivienne is sitting alone in a pew near the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Stop it! Why are you doing that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I hate an infection! Keep still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you keep still. He kisses Naomi passionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we going to do, Arthur?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get a job. I'll model cheap riding boots for people with no horses. You can write books about boys whose lungs have run away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop this! Vivienne walks up to the altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Bach-Templemead has never been poor and we're not about to try that experiment with you, Arthur. That said, you've shown strength of character for once, instead of blubbing on about frogs and friendship. The inheritance is yours. All I ask is, with Hobson gone, you finally start treating me like a mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Vivienne. I can't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've never earned that title. I wouldn't fake it with Susan. I won't with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur. I will withdraw this offer forever. Don't doubt me, boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't. Arthur shakes Vivienne's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care, Viv. Arthur takes Naomi by the hand and they leave the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur! Arthur! I am serious! If you walk out of that door... They're gone. Vivienne sits in a pew. For once she looks small, old, alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Naomi step into the daylight, pushing past paparazzi and press. Marty is waiting in the Batmobile, now repaired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Marty. This isn't mine any more. Fancy joining us for a bowl of Special J? Marty gets out. The three walk away up Amsterdam Avenue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . QUEENS - NIGHT CAPTION: ONE MONTH LATER ARTHUR (O.S.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naomi's typing, sipping `Sprike' (fake Sprite). Beside her is a printed manuscript titled `SNART'S FAKE NEW YORK - A Bogus guide to the World's Greatest City.' On the computer screen is: `...the 1765 Irish Hair Famine swept through Manhattan, rendering every resident bald for a week.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) This is outrageous!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHOWER - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Arthur's struggling with a very crap, piddly shower. Rather than the glory of Manhattan from his shower-in-the-sky, Arthur just has a bare wall opposite to look out on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Operational heat controls in a shower are a basic human right! A hole in a pipe sprays his groin with hot water. He screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SITTING ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Ralph and Marty sit watching sports, Marty cheering as the Yankees are losing, Ralph miserable, The doorbell rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM DOOR. NIGHT Ralph stands hammering at the bathroom door, holding a package.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Owww! My eyes! I'm blind! Ralph hammers again. The bathroom door opens. Arthur's holding a giant bottle of cheap shampoo. His eyes are bright red, streaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's in this shampoo? Napalm? It sure as hell isn't tea tree oil... Ralph hands him the package.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Package for you. With any luck an apartment for you and Lurch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you liked me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I may have been seduced by money. It happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SITTING ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Naomi appears from the bedroom. She finds Arthur staring at a framed photo of Hobson as a beautiful young woman holding Arthur as a happy, laughing toddler. A note is attached.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading it out) `Can I be your friend at least? Love, Vivienne xxx. P.S. Lunch sometime? P.P.S. The inheritance is yours. It always was.' Arthur looks at Naomi, at Ralph, at Marty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On balance, I'd go for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Money good. They look at Naomi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were never happy rich, honey. It's only been a month. Be strong. Remember: however hard life gets, love will always find a way. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off their stares:) What? Can't a girl make a joke?
direction.name: direction
